verses.text_plain: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
verses.verse_html: 1My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

verses.text_plain: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
verses.verse_html: 2So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

verses.text_plain: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
verses.verse_html:
3Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding; ▼
▼ liftest…: Heb. givest thy voice

footnotes.body_html: ▼ liftest…: Heb. givest thy voice

verses.text_plain: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
verses.verse_html: 4If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

verses.text_plain: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.
verses.verse_html: 5Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.

verses.text_plain: For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
verses.verse_html: 6For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

verses.text_plain: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
verses.verse_html: 7He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

verses.text_plain: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
verses.verse_html: 8He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

verses.text_plain: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
verses.verse_html: 9Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

verses.text_plain: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
verses.verse_html: 10When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

verses.text_plain: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
verses.verse_html: 11Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

verses.text_plain: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
verses.verse_html: 12To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

verses.text_plain: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
verses.verse_html: 13Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

verses.text_plain: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
verses.verse_html: 14Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

verses.text_plain: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
verses.verse_html: 15Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

verses.text_plain: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
verses.verse_html: 16To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

verses.text_plain: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
verses.verse_html: 17Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

verses.text_plain: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
verses.verse_html: 18For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

verses.text_plain: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
verses.verse_html: 19None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

verses.text_plain: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
verses.verse_html: 20That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

verses.text_plain: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
verses.verse_html: 21For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

verses.text_plain: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
verses.verse_html:
22But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it. ▼
▼ rooted: or, plucked up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rooted: or, plucked up
